history.content:
From the L&S docs at https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/advlatechangeclassschedule.pdf,

L&S students will be allowed up to two late action requests for add, drop, variable unit change, or grade option change in the same semester during their Berkeley career. Students can request one or two late action changes at different times, but must be in the same semester. The College of L&S will not consider additional requests in subsequent semesters.

tldr; no.

The deadline is the Friday of Dead week. So no, your request would not count. 


What you're interested in is a retro-drop. This is reviewed in an in person meeting with a Dean. Based on my experience working there, I highly doubt that your request would be approved (maybe not even reviewed), as it's considered an attempt to "manipulate" your GPA.

Hello, I understand that from Fall 2017, there is a new L&S policy that allows students once in their undergraduate years to unconditionally change their class courseload/ grading option, after their respective deadlines.

My question is that does this petition have to be done the same semester that you take the class? What if I wanted to retroactively change the grade of my class in a future semester. Let's say that during the Spring 2018 class, I petition to change the grade of a class I had in Fall 2017 from Letter Grade to P/NP. Would this be allowed? 

Thanks.
history.subject: Late Grade request changes question
